channel.title: I need somebody to code my PI
channel.description:
We are almost at the end of the stage of releasing the server however I have not too much time to spend coding as I am now at University and will be handing over my server to my co-owner.
I will make your time worth while.
http://pastebin.com/kuXGR4sN
Here is what I need doing.

item.title: I need somebody to code my PI
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ProjectDarkSouls:

Revising a server that is badly coded versus a server which is professionally coded would enlighten me more so than the badly coded one

Yes, but editing an already “complete” server would be useless, so you wouldn’t actually be going into the code to do much.

And there are plenty of bases that are wrote 100% better than PI that you could use, you just chose to go with a PI because you wanted all the content it came with.
So, you have no excuse.

Read full topic
item.source: I need somebody to code my PI

item.source: I need somebody to code my PI

item.title: I need somebody to code my PI
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ProjectDarkSouls:

The server I am using at the moment is using so many different things than I used to use on your average server. I used to code a hell of a lot last year, either a lot has changed or I am losing my touch. A lot of it Is just changing, I am more looking for a mentor.

Looking for someone to write code for you is not looking for a mentor.
They won’t be teaching you anything unless you explicitly ask them to. Most of the time they’ll just write what’s requested, make sure it works, and then move on to the next.

Read full topic
item.source: I need somebody to code my PI

item.title: I need somebody to code my PI
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s a lot of basics you’re asking for… Like, extremely basic.

Adding an item to a shop, that’s one of the first things I learned in RSPS. Literal.

Honestly cannot see how you’re near the “release date” of your server if you’re still stuck on such minor things.

Read full topic
